section.para: The ngx_http_js_module module is used to implement location and variable handlers in njs — a subset of the JavaScript language.
Download and install instructions are available here.

section.name: Example Configuration

directive.name: js_body_filter
directive.para:
Sets an njs function as a response body filter. The filter function is called for each data chunk of a response body with the following arguments:
data
the incoming data chunk, may be a string or Buffer depending on the buffer_type value, by default is a string.
flags
an object with the following properties:
last
a boolean value, true if data is a last buffer.
If the filter function changes the length of the response body, then it is required to clear out the Content-Length response header (if any) in js_header_filter to enforce chunked transfer encoding.

directive.name: js_content
directive.para: Sets an njs function as a location content handler. Since 0.4.0, a module function can be referenced.

directive.name: js_header_filter
directive.para: Sets an njs function as a response header filter. The directive allows changing arbitrary header fields of a response header.

directive.name: js_import
directive.para: Several js_import directives can be specified.

directive.name: js_include
directive.para: The directive is deprecated since 0.4.0, the directive should be used instead.

directive.name: js_path
directive.para: Sets an additional path for njs modules.

directive.name: js_set
directive.para: Sets an njs function for the specified variable. Since 0.4.0, a module function can be referenced.

section.name: Request Argument
section.para: Each HTTP njs handler receives one argument, a request object.
